descriptionNullable:
### Context

Newspaper articles are popular and diverse data sources for data scientists in various fields. To collect this kind of information, I built newspipe a scalable pipeline to crawl and extract data from news websites. Showing the power and flexibility of the pipeline, I collected articles from German-speaking publishers by providing the pipeline only with the URL of the website. This dataset is the result of the demonstration. I mainly crawled articles from 15 news sources over an extended period of time. The remaining 33 news sources were only test runs.

### Content

    text: article text as string
    tags: tags of the article (optional)
    Ausland: Articles with the tag 'Ausland' are marked with 1, otherwise '0'
    Deutschland: Articles with the tag 'Deutschland' are marked with 1, otherwise '0'
    Wirtschaft: Articles with the tag 'Wirtschaft' are marked with 1, otherwise '0'
    Panorama: Articles with the tag 'Panorama' are marked with 1, otherwise '0'
    Sport: Articles with the tag 'Sport' are marked with 1, otherwise '0'
    Coronavirus: Articles with the tag 'Coronavirus' are marked with 1, otherwise '0'
    Berlin: Articles with the tag 'Berlin' are marked with 1, otherwise '0'
    Politik: Articles with the tag 'Politik' are marked with 1, otherwise '0'
    news: : Articles with the tag 'news' are marked with 1, otherwise '0'

### Acknowledgements


The data in this dataset was originally published [here](https://www.kaggle.com/pqbsbk/german-news-dataset). The citation below refers to the dataset cited in the referenced page. The dataset inludes a notebook that shows how the content in this dataset was generated from the original data.

@misc{steven mi_2020, title={German News Dataset}, url={https://www.kaggle.com/dsv/1679751}, DOI={10.34740/KAGGLE/DSV/1679751}, publisher={Kaggle}, author={Steven Mi}, year={2020} }
title: German News
subtitle: Formated for Multilabel Multiclass Classification
